Package com.amiasya.core.interfaces

Class ChatProvider

java.lang.Object
com.amiasya.core.interfaces.ChatProvider
public abstract class ChatProvider extends Object
ChatProvider is the interface needed to be extended and registered to bukkit servicesmanager in order to communicate with the localization api

Since this interface manages all your localized messages, it is only resonable to be called ChatProvider.

Version:
1.3
Author:
MatthewSchwart

  • Method Details

    • getRequestedLocales

      public abstract Locale[] getRequestedLocales()
      This is the abstract method to be extended. It registers to localization api all the languages you want to display.
      Returns:
      Locale

    • getDefaultPropertiesWithLocale

      public abstract Properties getDefaultPropertiesWithLocale(Locale locale)
      This method is the first method to initialize your default messages into the properties files This method should return properties as explicitly stated
      Parameters:
      locale - The parameter to specify the language of the default properties
      Returns:
      properties files that contain the default messages
      See Also:
      • getDefaultMapWithLocale(java.util.Locale)

    • getDefaultMapWithLocale

      public abstract Map<String,String> getDefaultMapWithLocale(Locale locale)
      This method is the second method to set your default language messages into the properties files This method should return map obviously
      Parameters:
      locale - The parameter to specify the language of the default properties
      Returns:
      See Also:
      • getDefaultNodes(java.util.Locale)

    • getDefaultNodes

      public Set<String> getDefaultNodes(Locale locale)
      This method is the third method to set your default messages into the language properties. NOTE THAT this method does not intend to give default messages, only the language path. What it does it that it tries to ONLY SET THE PATH AND LEAVE THE MESSAGES FOR USER CONFIGURATION for the convience of developers
      Parameters:
      locale - The parameter to specify the language of the default LANGUAGE KEYS
      Returns:
      A set of language keys WITHOUT VALUES (ACTUAL MESSAGES)
      See Also:
      • getDefaultPropertiesWithLocale(java.util.Locale)

    • getLocaleMessages

      public Map<String,String> getLocaleMessages(Locale locale)
      This method is to be called after registering your ChatProvider to Bukkit services manager. This method retrieves all the locale messages with the given language (locale)
      Parameters:
      locale - the language to be used obviously
      Returns:
      A map that contains language key that corresponds to language messages

    • getLocaleMessage

      public String getLocaleMessage(Locale locale, String key)
      This method is to be called after registering your ChatProvider to Bukkit services manager. This method retrieves one locale message as specified by the language key This method does not translate the placeholders for you.
      Parameters:
      locale - the language to be used obviously
      key - the language key used to retrieve the message obviously
      Returns:
      the message obviously

    • getLocaleMessage

      public String getLocaleMessage(Locale locale, String key, String... args)
      This method is to be called after registering your ChatProvider to Bukkit services manager. This method is also used to retrieve one locale message by language key But this method tries to translate the placeholders that you have specified for you so that you dont have to do it yourself.
      Parameters:
      locale - the language to be used obviously
      key - the language key used to retrieve the message obviously
      args - The placeholders [%0] stands for the first argument, [%1] stands for the second argument ..... that you are going to put in.
      Returns:
      the message obviously

    • saveAllLang

      public void saveAllLang()
      This method is used to save all the language messages stored in memory into the properties file in case developers want to modify the messages at run time
      See Also:
      • saveLang(java.util.Locale)

    • saveLang

      public void saveLang(Locale locale)
      This method is used to save all the messages OF ONE SINGLE LANGUAGE SPECIFED in memory into the properties file in case developers want to modify the messages at run time
      Parameters:
      locale - the locale(language) for the messages to be updated obviously
      See Also:
      • saveAllLang()

      Reserved for internal uses, has no effect other than messing up your messages
